page.title: 20A WALK ON THE MOORS
page.content:
{THE SECOND WALK ON THE MOORS.}
We saw an old paraffin mil but it was all in pieces, except for an old fireplace which was still standing. We carried on until we got to the part of the moors where it was all peat. We found dry peat and damp peat. The damp peat was stacked in two rows, and every bit of peat was cut up into sections. The dry peat that we found was scattered around in different places. We found an old tree trunk and Mr. Eversham said it was over 2,000yrs old and could be as much as 4,000yrs old. We all stopped at a field of peat and watched a machine, it wasn't working, but the man started it up just for us. It was brill!
